name: Johannes Otterbach
summary: Johannes Otterbach is a technology enthusiast, hacker, scientist, and thought leader in AI and Quantum fields, with extensive experience as a panelist and consultant.
work_history: SPRIND - Bundesagentur für Sprunginnovationen: AI and Quantum (July 2024 - Present, Berlin, Germany). Orthogonal Otter UG: Chief Executive Officer (June 2023 - Present, Berlin, Germany). nyonic: Member of Technical Staff (February 2024 - April 2024), Chief Technology Officer (June 2023 - February 2024, Berlin, Germany). Merantix Momentum: VP Machine Learning Research (March 2022 - June 2023, Berlin, Germany). OpenAI: Member Of Technical Staff (December 2018 - April 2021, San Francisco Bay Area), Member Of Technical Staff (Fellow) (June 2018 - November 2018, San Francisco Bay Area). Rigetti Quantum Computing: Quantum Engineer (April 2017 - May 2018, San Francisco Bay Area). LendUp: Senior Data Scientist (December 2016 - April 2017), Data Scientist (August 2015 - November 2016, San Francisco Bay Area). Palantir Technologies: Infrastructure Engineer (April 2014 - July 2015). Harvard University: Postdoctoral Researcher (September 2011 - March 2014, Cambridge, MA, USA).
project_history: Publications include 'Bose-Einstein Condensation of Stationary-Light Polaritons', 'Photonic Phase Gate via an Exchange of Fermionic Spin Waves in a Spin Chain', 'Electromagnetically Induced Transparency with Rydberg Atoms', 'Photon-Photon Interactions via Rydberg Blockade', and 'Phonon-Induced Spin-Spin Interactions in Diamond Nanostructures: Application to Spin Squeezing'.
skills: Mathematical Modeling, Java, Python. Languages: English (Native or Bilingual), German (Native or Bilingual), French (Elementary), Swedish (Elementary).
education: Harvard University: Post-doctoral studies in Physics (2011 - 2014). Technische Universität Kaiserslautern: Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) in Physics (2008 - 2011), Diploma in Physics (2003 - 2008).
